title: Publications 2018
author: André K Eckhardt
text:
Publications 2018
-
Probing the Delicate Balance between Pauli Repulsion and London Dispersion with Triphenylmethyl Derivatives. Sören Rösel, Jonathan Becker, Wesley D. Allen and Peter R. Schreiner
J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2018, 140 (43), pp 14421–14432
[DOI: 10.1021/jacs.8b09145](https://pubs.acs.org/doi/full/10.1021/jacs.8b09145). Highlight: JACS [Spotlight](https://pubs.acs.org/doi/full/10.1021/jacs.8b11995).
- 1,3-Dioxolane-4-ol Hemiacetal Stores Formaldehyde and Glycolaldhyde in the Gas Phase. André K. Eckhardt, Raffael C. Wende, and Peter R. Schreiner
J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2018, 140,12333–12336.
[DOI: 10.1021/jacs.8b07480](https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/jacs.8b07480). Highlight: Cover picture of this issue.
- Tuning the Reactivity of Peroxo-Anhydrides for Aromatic C–H Bond Oxidation. Afsaneh Pilevar, Abolfazl Hosseini, Marina Šekutor, Heike Hausmann, Jonathan Becker, Kevin Turke and Peter R. Schreiner
J. Org. Chem. 2018, 83, 10070–10079.
[DOI: 10.1021/acs.joc.8b01392](https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/acs.joc.8b01392)
- Aerobic Aliphatic Hydroxylation Reactions by Copper Complexes: A Simple Clip-and-Cleave Concept. Jonathan Becker, Yevheniia Y. Zhyhadlo, Ekaterina D. Butova, Andrey A. Fokin, Fabian M. Metz, Peter R. Schreiner, Moritz Förster, Max C. Holthausen, Pascal Specht, and Siegfried Schindler
Chem. Eur. J. 2018, 24, 15543–15549.
[DOI: 10.1002/chem.201802607](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/chem.201802607)
Highlights: a) Front cover of this issue; b) Featured in
[Chemviews](https://www.chemistryviews.org/details/ezine/11100206/Clip-and-Cleave_Concept_for_Hydroxylation_Reactions.html)October 09, 2018.
- Experimental measurement of the diamond nucleation landscape reveals classical and nonclassical features. Functionalized Nanodiamonds, part 67. Matthew A. Gebbie, Patrick McQuade, Hitoshi Ishiwata, Vaclav Petrak, Andy Taylor, Jeremy E. Dahl, Robert M. K. Carlson, Andrey A. Fokin, Peter R. Schreiner, Zhi-Xun Shen, Milos Nesladek, and Nicholas A. Melosh

J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2018, 140, 9972–9978.
[DOI: 10.1021/jacs.8b05055](https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/jacs.8b05055)

Chem. Eur. J. 2018, 24, 11904-11907.
[DOI: 10.1002/chem.201802119](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1002/chem.201802119)

Angew. Chem Int. Ed. 2018, 57, 8336–8337.
[DOI: 10.1002/anie.201802088](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/anie.201802088); Angew. Chem. 2018, 130, 8468–8469. [DOI: 10.1002/ange.201802088](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/ange.201802088)
-
Gas-phase sugar formation using hydroxymethylene as the reactive formaldehyde isomer. André K. Eckhardt, Michael M. Linden, Raffael C. Wende, Bastian Bernhardt and Peter R. Schreiner
Nature Chem. 2018, 10, 1141–1147.
[DOI:](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41557-018-0128-2) [10.1038/s41557-018-0128-2](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41557-018-0128-2)
- Spectroscopic Evidence for Aminomethylene (H–C̈–NH2) – The Simplest Amino Carbene. André K. Eckhardt and Peter R. Schreiner
Angew. Chem Int. Ed. 2018, 57, 5248–5252.
[DOI: 10.1002/anie.201800679](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1002/anie.201800679); Angew. Chem 2018, 130, 5346–5350. [DOI: 10.1002/ange.201800679](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1002/ange.201800679)
Highlight: a) Noted as very important paper (top 5% of all Angewandte publications), b) Frontispiece of communications of this issue.

[Pressure squeezes reduction reactions out of crystals.](https://cen.acs.org/articles/96/i9/Pressure-squeezes-reduction-reactions-crystals.html)” Chem. Eng. News 2018, 96(9), p. 6 (“News of the Week); b) “ [In a first, tiny diamond anvils trigger chemical reactions by squeezing](https://phys.org/news/2018-02-tiny-diamond-anvils-trigger-chemical.html)” phys.org, Feb 21, 2018.
